page.title: 07SOUTHERN APPROACH S. REIGATE
page.content: From the south one approaches the block along the busy A217,linking Gat- wick and Heathrow Airports via Sidlow where the road crosses the River Mole by a stone bridge.This low-lying area is liable to flood in wet weather.To either side of the main road is open pasture land ,hedges,copses and large oak trees.The chalk escarpment of the North Downs can be seen beyond Reigate northwards. A mile beyond Sidlow Bridge are the Reigate Grammar School playing fields dominated by Rugby goal posts opposite the Doversgreen Home for the Elderly.Here the open country side gives way to housing estates criss- crossed by service roads.A little fur- ther on is a large cross-roads along- side the Angel Public House,and Wood- hatch shopping area.
